content.description: Sit start on large jug/rail, a dynamic move straight up gets you to a sloper rail (crux). From there finish straight up or move up and left around the arete. (Short jug finish for "The Easter Egg")
Start matched on sidepull undercling, right hand to a tiny crimp left of sloper (off), balance up as you bump your left hand up for the top-out.
content.location: Start in a small cave on the NE side of the boulder (rainbow bride side)

content.description: Starting on the problem The Easter Egg V4, climb intoÂ Egg Toss V5. An exciting slappy arete problem!
content.protection: Pads and Spotters is a plus
content.location: Left side of boulder on the main face.

content.description: Same start as Humpty Dumpty. Small power move to semi-sloper then reach for ledge. Work up to next ledge on slab then too out to finish
content.protection: Small boulder pad and spotter helpful, fall from top would be bad but top is pretty easy slab

content.description: Same start as easter egg, from jug rail turn corner to thin face. Make hard pulls on sharp edges to reach lip.

Sit start to Hard Boiled V3. The jug ledge to your left is off for the whole climb.

The feet are very low and there is small potential to dab on the rock below. My left foot was around the corner on a ledge, right foot was on a small nub that is obscured by a small black berry vine.

First move left hand into slot, right hand onto crimp gaston. You set your feet up and fire left hand into a floating move onto the slopey rail up and left. Keep heading left keeping in mind that the immediate jug rail is off for feet.

Round the last corner and top out for the last hard moves.
content.protection: Good landing at the start, worse as the climb progresses.
content.location: You start on two nice diagonal left facing holds and fire up and into Hard Boiled V3

content.description:
Left hand gaston slot under bulge, right hand near lip of bulge on opposing gaston. First move is crux floating left hand to the slopey rail, and turning the corner. Follow the hand rail to the left while keeping the giant jug ledge below off for added difficulty.

Turn the last western corner and top out
content.protection: As the climb progresses the landing gets worst, but the climbing is easier. Use pads and a spotter if you aren't solid with the grade.
content.location: South East side of boulder, where Humpty Dumpty ends. Stand start near the roof bulge.

content.description: Tricky crux at the beginning, and runs into the crux of Egg Toss V5.
content.protection: A pad for the start and two for the last crux.
content.location: The start is to the right of the massive jug rail. Right hand starts on a gaston flake near the propped boulder (which is off), left hand on a beautiful crimp right above a slight roof lip.

content.description: Sit start on right facing rail, left hand to side pull, huge left hand bump to sloping hold on arete, balancey right hand move. Climb some easier moves with no feet and top out.
content.protection: At least one large pad, with a sideways smaller to support it.
content.location: Sandwiched between Easter Egg V4 and Unknown V1-2

content.description: Lower into hole and start on side pull and large edge then traverse lip right on slopers. Pads are super dabby here being that the rock at your back is inches away. Route is short but powerful.
Sit start between the slab and overhang on two solid crimps. Traverse right to huge rail, then climb straight up. Top out has several variations, the most direct route however is the most exciting.
content.location: Central route on the southwest face.

content.description: This route starts matched on a sidepull undercling hold and follows "Egg & A Hard Place" halfway, then exits with a high step perch move, which happens after right hand on the second sloper.
content.protection: Small pads might do the trick
content.location: Start is inside a small cave on the NE side of the boulder (rainbow bridge side)
